Adapun Nabi Idris, adalah juga seorang yang saleh dan sabar. Ia diutus menjadi Rasul sesudah Nabi Syis dan Nabi Adam as. Banyak orang mengatakan bahwa Nabi Idris ini yang mula-mula pandai menjahit pakaian, dan mula-mula memakai pakaian yang dijahit, sedang orang-orang yang sebelumnya hanya memakai pakaian dari kulit binatang dan tidak dijahit. Selain itu dia pulalah orang yang mula-mula membuat dan memakai senjata api sebagai alat perlengkapan. Kisah Nabi Idris ini terdapat dalam Surah Maryam. (Maryam/19: 56-57)

Mengenai Zulkifli, menurut pendapat kebanyakan ahli tafsir, dia adalah seorang Nabi pula, dan putra dari Nabi Ayyub a.s. Allah mengutusnya menjadi Nabi sesudah ayahnya. Ia menjalankan dakwahnya mengesakan Allah baik dalam akidah maupun dalam ibadah. Selama hidupnya ia berdiam di negeri Syam, dan merupakan Nabi yang saleh dan sabar. Dan dia adalah dari kalangan Bani Israil.

Pada akhir ayat ini, Allah menegaskan bahwa Nabi Ismail, Idris dan Zulkifli telah dimasukkan-Nya dalam lingkungan rahmat-Nya, dan ditempatkan-Nya dalam surga Jannatuna'im, sebagai balasan atas kesabaran dan kesalehan mereka.
text.87:
Pada ayat ini Allah mengingatkan Rasul-Nya dan kaum Muslimin semuanya, kepada kisah Nabi Yunus, yang pada permulaan ayat ini disebutkan dengan nama "dzun Nun".

dzu berarti "yang mempunyai", sedang an-Nun berarti "ikan besar". Maka dzu an-Nun berarti "Yang empunya ikan besar". Ia dinamakan demikian, karena pada suatu ketika ia pernah dijatuhkan ke laut dan ditelan oleh seekor ikan besar. Kemudian, karena pertolongan Allah, maka ia dapat keluar dari perut ikan tersebut dengan selamat dan dalam keadaan utuh.

Perlu diingat, bahwa kisah Nabi Yunus di dalam Al-Qur'an terdapat pada dua buah surah, yaitu Surah al-Anbiya' dan Surah shad. Apabila kita bandingkan antara ayat-ayat yang terdapat pada kedua Surah tersebut yang mengandung kisah Nabi Yunus ini, terdapat beberapa persamaan, misalnya dalam ungkapan-ungkapan yang berbunyi:

Betapa banyak umat sebelum mereka yang telah Kami binasakan, lalu mereka meminta tolong padahal (waktu itu) bukanlah saat untuk lari melepaskan diri. (shad/38: 3)

Ungkapan tersebut terdapat dalam Surah al-Anbiya' ini, dan terdapat pula dalam ayat Surah shad. Perhatikan pula al-Anbiya'/21:11 dan Yunus/10: 13.

Dalam ayat ini Allah berfirman, mengingatkan manusia pada kisah Nabi Yunus, ketika ia pergi dalam keadaan marah. Yang dimaksud ialah bahwa pada suatu ketika Nabi Yunus sangat marah kepada kaumnya, karena mereka tidak juga beriman kepada Allah. Ia telah diutus Allah sebagai Rasul-Nya untuk menyampaikan seruan kepada umatnya, untuk mengajak mereka kepada agama Allah. Tetapi hanya sedikit saja di antara mereka yang beriman, sedang sebagian besar mereka tetap saja ingkar dan durhaka. Keadaan yang demikian itu menjadikan ia marah, lalu pergi ke tepi laut, menjauhkan diri dari kaumnya.

Kisah ini memberi kesan bahwa Nabi Yunus tidak dapat berlapang hati dan sabar menghadapi umatnya. Akan tetapi memang demikianlah keadaannya, ia termasuk nabi-nabi yang sempit dada. Memang dari sekian banyak Nabi dan Rasul yang diutus Allah, hanya lima orang saja yang disebut "Ulul Azmi", yaitu rasul-rasul yang amat sabar dan ulet. Mereka adalah Nabi Ibrahim, Musa, Isa, Nuh dan Muhammad saw. Sedang yang lain-lainnya, walaupun mereka ma'shum dari dosa besar dan sifat-sifat yang tercela, namun pada saat-saat tertentu sempit juga dada mereka menghadapi kaum yang ingkar dan durhaka kepada Allah.

Akan tetapi, walaupun Nabi Yunus pada suatu ketika marah kepada kaumnya, namun kemarahannya itu dapat dipahami, karena ia sangat ikhlas kepada mereka, dan sangat ingin agar mereka memperoleh kebahagiaan dunia dan akhirat dengan menjalankan agama Allah yang disampaikannya kepada mereka. Tetapi ternyata sebagian besar dari mereka itu tetap ingkar dan durhaka. Inilah yang menyakitkan hatinya, dan mengobarkan kemarahannya.

Nabi Muhammad sendiri, walaupun sudah termasuk ulul 'azmi, namun Allah beberapa kali memberi peringatan kepada beliau agar jangan sampai marah dan bersempit hati menghadapi kaumnya yang ingkar. Allah berfirman dalam ayat yang lain:

Maka bersabarlah engkau (Muhammad) terhadap ketetapan Tuhanmu, dan janganlah engkau seperti (Yunus) orang yang berada dalam (perut) ikan. (al- Qalam/68: 48)

Firman-Nya lagi kepada Nabi Muhammad saw:

Maka boleh jadi engkau (Muhammad) hendak meninggalkan sebagian dari apa yang diwahyukan kepadamu dan dadamu sempit karenanya. (Hud/11: 12)

Ringkasnya sifat marah yang terdapat pada Nabi Yunus bukanlah timbul dari sifat yang buruk, melainkan karena kekesalan hatinya melihat keingkaran kaumnya yang semula diharapkannya untuk menerima dan melaksanakan agama Allah yang disampaikannya.

Selanjutnya dalam ayat ini Allah menjelaskan kesalahan Nabi Yunus dimana kemarahannya itu menimbulkan kesan bahwa seolah-olah dia mengira bahwa sebagai Nabi dan Rasul Allah tidak akan pernah dibiarkan menghadapi kesulitan, sehingga jalan yang dilaluinya akan selalu indah tanpa halangan.

Akan tetapi dalam kenyatan tidak demikian. Pada umumnya para rasul dan nabi banyak menemui rintangan, bahkan siksaan dan ejekan terhadap dirinya dari orang-orang yang ingkar. Hanya saja dalam keadaan yang sangat gawat, baik dimohon atau tidak oleh yang bersangkutan, Allah mendatangkan pertolongan-Nya, sehingga Rasul-Nya selamat dan umatnya yang ingkar itu mengalami kebinasaan.

Menurut riwayat yang dinukil dari Ibnu Kashir, bahwa ketika Nabi Yunus dalam keadaan marah, ia lalu menjauhkan diri dari kaumnya pergi ke tepi pantai. Di sana ia menjumpai sebuah perahu, lalu ia ikut serta naik ke perahu itu dengan wajah yang muram. Di kala perahu itu hendak berlayar, datanglah gelombang besar yang menyebabkan perahu itu terancam tenggelam apabila muatannya tidak segera dikurangi. Maka nahkoda perahu itu berkata, "Tenggelamnya seseorang lebih baik daripada tenggelamnya kita semua." Lalu diadakan undian untuk menentukan siapakah di antara mereka yang harus dikeluarkan dari perahu itu. Setelah diundi, ternyata bahwa Nabi Yunuslah yang harus dikeluarkan. Akan tetapi, penumpang kapal itu merasa keberatan mengeluarkannya dari pertahu itu. Maka undian dilakukan sekali lagi, tetapi hasilnya tetap demikian. Bahkan undian yang ketiga kalinya pun demikian pula. Akhirnya Yunus melepaskan pakaiannya, lalu ia terjun ke laut atas kemauannya sendiri. Allah mengirim seekor ikan besar yang berenang dengan cepat lalu menelan Yunus.

Dalam ayat ini selanjutnya Allah menerangkan bahwa setelah Nabi Yunus berada dalam tiga tingkat "kegelapan berbeda", maka ia berdoa kepada Allah, "Tidak ada Tuhan selain Engkau, Mahasuci Engkau, sesungguhnya aku termasuk orang-orang yang zalim."

Yang dimaksud dengan tiga kegelapan berbeda di sini ialah bahwa Nabi Yunus sedang berada di dalam perut ikan yang gelap, dalam laut yang dalam dan gelap, dan di malam hari yang gelap gulita pula.

Pengakuan Nabi Yunus bahwa dia "termasuk golongan orang-orang yang zalim", berarti dia sadar atas kesalahannya yang telah dilakukannya sebagai Nabi dan Rasul, yaitu tidak sabar dan tidak berlapang dada menghadapi kaumnya, seharusnya ia bersabar sampai menunggu datangnya ketentuan Allah atas kaumnya yang ingkar itu.

Karena kesadaran itu maka ia mohon ampun kepada Allah, dan mohon pertolongan-Nya untuk menyelamatkan dirinya dari malapetaka itu.
text.88:
Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa Allah mengabulkan doa Nabi Yunus, lalu diselamatkannya dari rasa duka yang amat sangat. Duka karena rasa bersalah, duka karena keingkaran umatnya, dan duka karena malapetaka yang menimpa dirinya.

Pada akhir ayat ini Allah menegaskan bahwa demikianlah Dia menyelamatkan mereka dari azab duniawi dan mengaruniakan mereka kebahagiaan ukhrawi. Hal ini diterangkan Allah dalam firman-Nya pada ayat yang lain:

Maka mengapa tidak ada (penduduk) suatu negeri pun yang beriman, lalu imannya itu bermanfaat kepadanya selain kaum Yunus? Ketika mereka (kaum Yunus itu), beriman, Kami hilangkan dari mereka azab yang menghinakan dalam kehidupan dunia, dan Kami beri kesenangan kepada mereka sampai waktu tertentu. (Yunus/10: 98)

Sesuai dengan kisah Yunus ini Nabi mengajarkan umatnya yang sedang mengalami kesulitan untuk berdoa seperti doa Nabi Yunus. Mus'ab bin Umair meriwayatkan dari Rasulullah bersabda:

Siapa yang berdoa dengan doa Nabi Yunus, maka akan dikabulkan. (Riwayat at-Tirmidzi)
text.89:
Pada ayat ini Allah mengarahkan perhatian Nabi Muhammad saw dan umatnya kepada kisah Nabi Zakaria. Karena ia tidak mempunyai anak, maka ia merasa kesepian dan tidak mempunyai seorang pun keturunan yang akan menggantikan dan melanjutkan perjuangannya bila ia telah meninggal dunia. Sebab itu ia berdoa kepada Allah agar Dia tidak membiarkannya hidup tanpa keturunan.

Pada akhir ayat ini disebutkan ucapan Nabi Zakaria setelah ia mengucapkan doanya itu. Lalu ia berkata, "Dan Engkau adalah ahli waris yang paling baik?" Maksudnya ialah bahwa apabila Allah menghendaki tidak akan menganugerahkan keturunan kepadanya, maka ia pun rela dan tidak berkecil hati, karena ia yakin bahwa Allah akan tetap memelihara agamanya, dan tidak akan menyia-nyiakan agamanya dan Allah tentu akan memilih orang yang paling tepat sebagai pengganti Zakaria setelah wafatnya.

Kisah ini telah dibahas lebih luas dalam Surah Ali 'Imran dan Surah Maryam.
text.90:
Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa Allah telah memperkenankan doa Nabi Zakaria itu, dan mengaruniakan kepadanya seorang putra bernama Yahya. Untuk itu Allah telah mengaruniakan kesehatan yang baik kepada istri Zakaria, sehingga memungkinkan untuk mengandung, padahal sebelum itu ia adalah perempuan yang mandul.

Pada lanjutan ayat ini Allah menjelaskan apa alasan-Nya untuk mengabulkan permohonan Zakaria itu, ialah karena mereka semua senantiasa bersegera dalam berbuat kebajikan, terutama dalam memelihara keturunan dengan sebaik-baiknya. Selain itu juga, karena senantiasa berdoa kepada Allah dengan hati yang harap-harap cemas, harap akan ampunan Tuhan dan cemas terhadap kemurkaan dan siksaan Allah. Dan alasan ketiga ialah karena mereka selalu khusyuk dan tawadu' kepada-Nya, dan tidak pernah sombong atau takabur dan mengingkari karunia-Nya.

Jadi, sifat-sifat yang mulia itulah yang menyebabkan mereka memperoleh karunia dari Allah.
text.91:
Pada ayat ini Allah menerangkan kisah Maryam secara ringkas, yaitu bahwa dia adalah seorang perempuan yang memelihara kehormatan dirinya, maka suatu ketika Allah mengutus malaikat Jibril untuk memberitahukan Maryam bahwa Allah meniupkan ruh ke dalam tubuh Maryam sehingga ia mengandung, kemudian Maryam melahirkan Isa as tanpa ayah. Oleh karena Isa lahir tanpa ayah, maka Maryam dan Isa lalu menjadi salah satu bukti bagi seluruh isi alam ini, tentang kekuasaan dan kemahaesaan Allah. Kelahiran Isa mengandung bukti dan tanda kekuasaan Allah sebagaimana halnya Nabi Adam yang lahir ke dunia tanpa ayah dan ibu, sedang Isa lahir tanpa ayah saja.

Hal yang membuat heran adalah karena Maryam belum pernah mengadakan hubungan apa pun dengan kaum lelaki, baik secara halal melalui perkawinan, apalagi secara tidak halal. Allah menyebutkan ucapan Maryam mengenai dirinya sendiri sebagai berikut:

Tidak pernah ada orang (laki-laki) yang menyentuhku dan aku bukan seorang pezina!" (Maryam/19: 20)

Firman Allah dalam ayat lain;

Dan Maryam putri Imran yang memelihara kehormatannya. (at-Tahrim/66: 12)

Keheranan Maryam yang disampaikan kepada Malaikat Jibril dijawab degan firman Allah:

Dia (Jibril) berkata, "Demikianlah." Tuhanmu berfirman, "Hal itu mudah bagi-Ku. (Maryam/19 : 21)

Tanda-tanda kebesaran dan kekuasaan Allah yang diperlihatkan kepada diri Maryam ialah bahwa dia hamil tanpa melalui hubungan kelamin dengan siapa pun, dan malaikat senantiasa menyediakan makanan untuknya.

Mengenai hal ini Al-Qur'an menceritakan pertanyaan Zakaria kepada Maryam dan jawaban Maryam kepadanya:

"Wahai Maryam! Dari mana ini engkau peroleh?" Dia (Maryam) menjawab, "Itu dari Allah." (Ali 'Imran/3: 37)

Adapun tanda-tanda kebesaran dan kemahakuasaan Allah yang terlihat melalui diri Isa as, sudah diterangkan dengan panjang lebar dalam Surah Ali 'Imran dan Surah Maryam.
text.92:
Dalam ayat ini ditegaskan bahwa agama tauhid ini adalah agama untuk seluruh manusia, dan merupakan agama yang satu, yaitu sama dalam akidah, meskipun berbeda dalam syariat.

Rasulullah bersabda, "Kami para nabi seperti ibarat saudara-saudara se ayah, agama kami satu." (Riwayat al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Daud dan Ahmad dari Abu Hurairah.)

Kemudian pada akhir ayat ini ditegaskan bahwa Allah adalah Tuhan bagi seluruh umat manusia. Oleh sebab itu kepada-Nya sajalah mereka harus menyembah.
text.93:
Dalam ayat ini Allah memperingatkan kaum Muslimin atas perpecahan yang timbul antara umat manusia. Seluruh umat manusia itu seharusnya menganut agama tauhid, karena agama yang diturunkan Allah adalah satu, yaitu agama tauhid (agama Islam). Akan tetapi mereka telah berpecah belah, sehingga kesatuan mereka menjadi terkotak-kotak kecil yang dipisahkan dengan ketat oleh perbedaan pandangan, baik mengenai masalah-masalah yang tidak prinsip dalam agama maupun masalah-masalah duniawi semata. Perbedaan-perbedaan paham itu pada umumnya disertai taklid kepada imam atau pemimpin sehingga kelompok yang satu menutup diri terhadap kelompok yang lain. Dengan demikian mereka sudah melalaikan ajaran agama, yang menyuruh mereka bersatu dan memelihara kesatuan umat. Akan tetapi mereka berbuat sebaliknya, yaitu berpecah belah.

Pada akhir ayat ini ditegaskan, bahwa umat manusia yang sudah berpecah belah itu, seluruhnya akan kembali kepada-Nya juga. Maka Allah akan melakukan hisab dan memberikan balasan atas keimanan dan amal mereka masing-masing.
text.94:
Dalam ayat ini Allah menjamin bahwa amal kebajikan yang dilakukan oleh seseorang yang beriman, betapapun kecilnya, namun Allah akan membalasnya dengan kebaikan pula. Amal kebajikan itu tidak akan hilang percuma, dan tidak akan diingkari karena Allah telah menuliskannya untuk orang yang melakukannya.

Jaminan Allah untuk memberikan balasan atas setiap kebajikan hamba-Nya terdapat dalam firman-Nya:

Dan barang siapa menghendaki kehidupan akhirat dan berusaha ke arah itu dengan sungguh-sungguh, sedangkan dia beriman, maka mereka itulah orang yang usahanya dibalas dengan baik. (al-Isra'/17: 19)

Firman-Nya lagi pada ayat yang lain:

Sungguh, mereka yang beriman dan mengerjakan kebajikan, Kami benar-benar tidak akan menyia-nyiakan pahala orang yang mengerjakan perbuatan yang baik itu. (al-Kahf/18: 30)
text.95:
Pada ayat ini dijelaskan bahwa tidak mungkinlah bagi penduduk suatu negeri yang telah dibinasakan dengan azab-Nya, bahwa mereka tidak akan kembali kepada-Nya.

Maksudnya, kaum yang ingkar dan kafir itu, walaupun sudah dibinasakan dengan azab yang berat di dunia, namun mereka pasti akan kembali kepada Allah di akhirat kelak, lalu dihisab semua amalannya, dan diberi balasan yang setimpal.
text.96: Dalam ayat ini Allah menerangkan bahwa kaum kafir telah dibinasakan dengan azab yang berat di dunia ini, sehingga mereka menemui kemusnahan, mereka tidak akan kembali lagi ke dunia, mereka akan tetap dalam kemusnahan sampai hari Kiamat kelak. Sebagai salah satu dari tanda-tanda akan datangnya hari Kiamat adalah terbukanya tembok Yakjuj dan Makjuj, sehingga Yakjuj dan Makjuj berdatangan, meluncur dengan cepat dari setiap tempat yang tinggi. Mereka membuat keonaran dan kebinasaan di dunia.
text.97:
Pada ayat ini ditegaskan, bahwa pada waktu keluarnya Yakjuj dan Makjuj itu, dan di waktu telah dekatnya saat kedatangan janji yang benar, yaitu hari kebangkitan dan hisab, maka dengan serta merta terbelalaklah mata kaum kafir karena terkejut, seraya berteriak dengan nada penyesalan, "Aduhai celakalah kami, benar-benar kami lalai tentang kedatangan hari kebangkitan dan hisab, sehingga kami tidak mempersiapkan diri kami dengan baik. Bahkan kami ini adalah orang-orang yang zalim atas diri kami dan terhadap orang lain, karena kami telah diberi peringatan bahwa hari kebangkitan dan hisab itu benar-benar akan datang, tetapi kami tidak mengindahkan peringatan itu, bahkan mendustakannya.

Akan tetapi, betapa pun mereka menyesali dirinya pada saat itu namun penyesalan itu sudah tidak berguna lagi, karena saat kebangkitan dan hisab itu memang benar-benar datang, sedang mereka tidak percaya sedikitpun.
text.98:
Ayat ini menegaskan kepada orang-orang musyrik Mekah bahwa mereka beserta apa yang mereka sembah selain Allah, selama mereka hidup di dunia, seperti patung, binatang, benda-benda mati, pohon atau tempat keramat dan sebagainya akan dimasukkan ke dalam neraka Jahannam. Hal ini merupakan janji Allah kepada mereka, yang pasti ditepati-Nya.

Dalam ayat ini disebutkan bahwa orang-orang musyrik beserta sembahan-sembahan mereka akan dimasukkan ke dalam neraka, padahal yang berdosa dan memperserikatkan Tuhan dalam hal ini ialah penyembah-penyembahnya. Adapun sembahan-sembahan itu mereka tidak tahu menahu apa yang diperbuat oleh penyembah-penyembahnya. Hikmah menyertakan sembahan-sembahan itu beserta penyembah-penyembahnya ialah untuk memperlihatkan kepada mereka bahwa kepercayaan mereka terhadap sembahan-sembahan itu sewaktu di dunia adalah tidak benar. Mereka waktu di dunia dahulu mempercayai bahwa patung-patung dan segala apa yang mereka sembah itu akan memberi syafaat kepada mereka di hari Kiamat, sehingga mereka terhindar dari azab Allah. Dengan perantara sembahan-sembahan itu mereka akan dimasukkan ke dalam surga. Setelah hari Kiamat datang dan setelah mereka masuk ke dalam neraka bersama-sama dengan sembahan-sembahan yang mereka sembah itu, ternyata sembahan-sembahan itu tidak dapat berbuat sesuatu pun terhadap mereka. Dengan demikian terbuktilah kesalahan kepercayaan yang mereka anut dan kebenaran risalah yang pernah disampaikan Muhammad kepada mereka.
text.99: Ayat ini menerangkan seandainya sembahan-sembahan yang disembah orang-orang musyrik itu benar tuhan di samping Allah sebagaimana kepercayaan mereka, tentulah sembahan itu akan selamat bersama-sama mereka, karena jika ia tuhan tentulah ia mahakuasa dan perkasa, tidak ada sesuatu pun yang dapat menyiksanya, bahkan ia sendirilah yang akan menyiksa orang-orang yang durhaka padanya. Akan tetapi yang terjadi ialah bahwa semuanya itu baik penyembah-penyembah berhala, maupun sembahan-sembahan yang disembah akan kekal di dalam neraka.
text.100:
Kemudian Allah menerangkan keadaan penyembah berhala- berhala itu beserta sembahan-sembahan mereka di dalam neraka, yaitu:

1. Mereka di dalam neraka mengeluh dan merintih dan nafas mereka menjadi sesak menanggung azab yang tiada terperikan dahsyatnya.

Maka adapun orang-orang yang sengsara, maka (tempatnya) di dalam neraka, di sana mereka mengeluarkan dan menarik nafas dengan merintih. (Hud/11:106)

2. Penyembah-penyembah berhala yang sedang diazab itu tidak dapat mengetahui keadaan temannya yang lain yang juga diazab, karena mereka tidak sempat memikirkannya, masing-masing mereka sibuk menghadapi azab yang selalu menimpa mereka.
text.101:
Pada ayat ini diterangkan keadaan orang-orang yang beriman dan mengerjakan amal saleh serta orang-orang yang telah diberi Allah taufik untuk taat kepada-Nya, bahwa mereka tidak dimasukkan ke dalam neraka bahkan mereka sedikit pun tidak didekatkan kepadanya.

Diriwayatkan oleh al-Hakim dari Ibnu Abbas, bahwa waktu ayat 98 diturunkan, orang-orang musyrik Quraisy merasa terpukul karenanya. Mereka berkata, "Muhammad telah memaki-maki tuhan-tuhan kita. Lalu mereka pergi kepada Ibnu az-Ziba'ra dan menceritakan tentang ayat yang diturunkan itu, dia menjawab, "Kalau saya berhadapan dengan Muhammad tentulah saya dapat membantahnya." Orang-orang musyrik Quraisy itu berkata, "Apakah yang kamu katakan." Dia menjawab, "Aku mengatakan kepadanya, "Al- Masih disembah orang-orang Nasrani, 'Uzair disembah orang Yahudi, apakah Al-Masih dan 'Uzair itu akan menjadi bahan bakar api neraka? Orang-orang Quraisy tertarik hatinya mendengar ucapan Ibnu az-Ziba'ra dan merasa telah dapat mengalahkan Muhammad. Maka turunlah ayat 99 sampai 101 Surah ini, yang menegaskan ayat 98 di atas.

Dengan turunnya ayat-ayat ini Ibnu az-Ziba'ra bungkam dan bimbanglah kembali hati orang-orang musyrik. Tetapi karena kedengkian mereka kepada Nabi Muhammad dan kaum Muslimin, maka mereka tetap dalam kemusyrikan mereka.
text.102:
. Allah menerangkan keadaan penduduk surga, yaitu:

1. Mereka tidak mendengar suara api neraka yang ditimbulkan oleh gejolak apinya dan bunyi menghanguskan barang-barang yang sedang dibakar.

2. Mereka berada dalam kesenangan dan kegembiraan yang tidak putusputusnya, menikmati segala yang mereka inginkan, mendengar segala yang menyenangkan hati dan melihat apa yang disenangi mata mereka.

3. Mereka tidak dirisaukan oleh bunyi sangkakala yang terakhir, yaitu bunyi sangkakala yang menandakan kebangkitan manusia dari kubur untuk dihisab, Allah berfirman:

Dan sangkakala pun ditiup, maka matilah semua (makhluk) yang di langit dan di bumi kecuali mereka yang dikehendaki Allah. Kemudian ditiup sekali lagi (sangkakala itu) maka seketika itu mereka bangun (dari kuburnya) menunggu (keputusan Allah). (az-Zumar/39: 68)

4. Mereka disambut para malaikat dengan menyampaikan kabar gembira atas kemenangan mereka. Seakan-akan malaikat menyampaikan kepada mereka, "Inilah hari yang pernah dijanjikan Allah kepadamu hai orang-orang yang beriman sewaktu di dunia dahulu, pada saat ini Allah melimpahkan pahala yang besar dan kesenangan yang abadi sebagai balasan atas keimanan, ketaatan, dan kesucian dirimu dari perbuatan dosa dengan mengerjakan amal-amal saleh dan dengan melaksanakan semua perintah Allah dan menjauhi semua yang dilarang-Nya."
text.103:
. Allah menerangkan keadaan penduduk surga, yaitu:

1. Mereka tidak mendengar suara api neraka yang ditimbulkan oleh gejolak apinya dan bunyi menghanguskan barang-barang yang sedang dibakar.

2. Mereka berada dalam kesenangan dan kegembiraan yang tidak putusputusnya, menikmati segala yang mereka inginkan, mendengar segala yang menyenangkan hati dan melihat apa yang disenangi mata mereka.

3. Mereka tidak dirisaukan oleh bunyi sangkakala yang terakhir, yaitu bunyi sangkakala yang menandakan kebangkitan manusia dari kubur untuk dihisab, Allah berfirman:

Dan sangkakala pun ditiup, maka matilah semua (makhluk) yang di langit dan di bumi kecuali mereka yang dikehendaki Allah. Kemudian ditiup sekali lagi (sangkakala itu) maka seketika itu mereka bangun (dari kuburnya) menunggu (keputusan Allah). (az-Zumar/39: 68)

4. Mereka disambut para malaikat dengan menyampaikan kabar gembira atas kemenangan mereka. Seakan-akan malaikat menyampaikan kepada mereka, "Inilah hari yang pernah dijanjikan Allah kepadamu hai orang-orang yang beriman sewaktu di dunia dahulu, pada saat ini Allah melimpahkan pahala yang besar dan kesenangan yang abadi sebagai balasan atas keimanan, ketaatan, dan kesucian dirimu dari perbuatan dosa dengan mengerjakan amal-amal saleh dan dengan melaksanakan semua perintah Allah dan menjauhi semua yang dilarang-Nya."
text.104:
Orang-orang yang mendapat sambutan para malaikat itu tidak merasa gentar dan terkejut dengan datangnya hari Kiamat, di waktu langit dilipat dan diganti dengan langit yang lain, seakan-akan langit yang lama dilipat untuk disimpan dan langit yang baru dikembangkan. Allah berfirman:

Dan mereka tidak mengagungkan Allah sebagaimana mestinya padahal bumi seluruhnya dalam genggaman-Nya pada hari Kiamat dan langit digulung dengan tangan kanan-Nya. Mahasuci Dia dan Mahatinggi Dia dari apa yang mereka persekutukan. (az-Zumar/39: 67)

Demikianlah Allah membangkitkan manusia setelah mereka mati dan berada di dalam kubur, untuk dikumpulkan di padang mahsyar, agar dapat dihisab amal perbuatan mereka. Membangkitkan manusia setelah mati dan hancur menjadi tanah adalah mudah bagi Allah. Jika Allah menciptakan manusia dari tidak ada menjadi ada, tentulah mengulangi kembali menciptakannya adalah lebih mudah dari menciptakan pertama kali. Membangkitkan manusia kembali untuk dihisab itu adalah suatu janji dari Allah yang pasti ditepati-Nya.

Secara saintis, sebagaimana telah dijelaskan dalam ayat 30 dari surah ini, penciptaan alam semesta dimulai dari ketiadaan (keadaan singularitas: massa tak terhingga besarnya, volume tak terhingga kecilnya) yang kemudian meledak dahsyat dan kemudian membentuk alam semesta yang terus mengembang sampai dengan saat ini. Bukti tentang alam semesta yang mengembang ini dapat ditemukan pada hasil pengamatan dengan teleskop yang menunjukkan bahwa dengan berjalannya waktu, jarak antara benda-benda langit semakin menjauh. Para ilmuwan mengatakan bahwa alam semesta akan terus mengembang sampai dengan dicapainya massa kritis alam semesta. Apabila massa kritis ini telah tercapai, maka gaya tarik menarik (gravitasi) antara massa berbagai benda langit akan menahan proses pengembangan alam semesta. 

Bahkan akan tercapai keadaan kontraksi alam semesta. Alam semesta yang semula mengembang akan mengkerut (berkontraksi) mengecil dan suatu saat akan hancur dan kembali pada keadaan awal (singularitas); keadaan seperti inilah yang disebut hari kiamat. Hari kiamat dalam ayat ini digambarkan sebagai hari di mana Allah akan "menggulung langit", bagaikan menggulung lembaran-lembaran kertas, sebagaimana halnya awal penciptaan yang pertama. Istilah "menggulung langit" adalah ungkapan yang tepat, karena sesungguhnya alam semesta tidak bundar melainkan datar terdiri dari trilyunan galaksi yang membentuk "gulungan".
text.105:
Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa Allah telah menurunkan kitab kepada para Rasul, seperti Taurat, Zabur, Injil dan Al-Qur'an. Dalam kitab-kitab itu diterangkan bahwa bumi ini adalah kepunyaan Allah, diwariskan kepada siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya. Allah telah menetapkan juga dalam ayat ini, bahwa hamba-hamba yang mewarisi bumi itu ialah hamba-hamba yang sanggup mengolah bumi dan memakmurkannya, selama dia mengikuti petunjuk Allah.

Jika diperhatikan sejarah dunia dan sejarah umat manusia, maka orang-orang yang dijadikan Allah sebagai penguasa di bumi ini, ialah orang-orang yang sanggup mengatur dan memimpin masyarakat, mengolah bumi ini untuk kepentingan umat manusia, sanggup mempertahankan diri dari serangan luar dan dapat mengokohkan persatuan rakyat yang ada di negaranya. Pemberian kekuasaan oleh Allah kepada orang-orang tersebut bukanlah berarti Allah telah meridai tindakan-tindakan mereka; karena kehidupan duniawi lain halnya dengan kehidupan ukhrawi. Ada orang yang bahagia hidup di akhirat saja, dan ada pula yang bahagia hidup di dunia saja. Sedangkan yang dicita-citakan seorang muslim ialah bahagia hidup di dunia dan di akhirat.

Apabila orang muslim ingin hidup bahagia di dunia dan akhirat, mereka harus mengikuti Sunnatullah di atas, yaitu taat beribadah kepada Allah, sanggup memimpin umat manusia dengan baik, sanggup mengolah bumi ini untuk kepentingan umat manusia, menggalang persatuan dan kesatuan yang kuat di antara meraka sehingga tidak mudah dipecah belah oleh musuh.

Para mufasir berbeda pendapat dalam menafsirkan kata "bumi" dalam ayat ini, di antaranya:

a. Sebagian ahli tafsir mengartikan "bumi" dalam ayat ini dengan "surga". Karena "surga" itu diwariskan Allah kepada hamba-hamba-Nya yang beriman dan beramal saleh. Firman Allah:

Dan mereka berkata, "Segala puji bagi Allah yang telah memenuhi janji-Nya kepada kami dan telah memberikan tempat ini kepada kami sedang kami (diperkenankan) menempati surga di mana saja yang kami kehendaki." Maka (surga itulah) sebaik-baik balasan bagi orang-orang yang beramal. (az-Zumar/39: 74)

b. Sebagian yang lain mengartikan kata "bumi" dengan bumi yang sekarang ditempati umat manusia. Firman Allah: 

Allah telah menjanjikan kepada orang-orang di antara kamu yang beriman dan yang mengerjakan kebajikan, bahwa Dia sungguh, akan menjadikan mereka berkuasa di bumi. (an-Nur/24: 55)

"Sesungguhnya bumi (ini) milik Allah; diwariskan-Nya kepada siapa saja yang Dia kehendaki di antara hamba-hamba-Nya. Dan kesudahan (yang baik) adalah bagi orang-orang yang bertakwa." (al-A'raf/7: 128)

c. Sebagian mufasir lain mengartikan "bumi" dengan tanah suci yang diwarisi oleh orang yang saleh, firman Allah:

Dan Kami wariskan kepada kaum yang tertindas itu, bumi bagian timur dan bagian baratnya yang telah Kami berkahi. (al-A'raf/7: 137)
text.106:
Allah menerangkan bahwa segala kisah yang diterangkan dalam surah ini adalah pelajaran dan peringatan yang disampaikan sejak awal sampai akhir surah ini, cukup menjadi pelajaran dan banyak hikmah yang terkandung di dalamnya, sebagai bekal dan bahan bagi orang yang ingin mencapai kebahagiaan hidup di dunia dan di akhirat. Bahkan ayat-ayat dalam surah ini merupakan peringatan dan ancaman yang keras dari Allah kepada orang-orang yang mengingkari seruan para rasul. Mereka akan ditimpa oleh malapetaka yang besar, sebagaimana telah ditimpakan kepada umat-umat dahulu.

Karena itu kaum Muslimin wajib mengambil pelajaran dan mengamalkan ayat-ayat tersebut agar tidak terkena ancaman Allah yang berupa azab dan malapetaka yang sangat dahsyat.
text.107:
Tujuan Allah mengutus Nabi Muhammad yang membawa agama-Nya itu, tidak lain adalah memberi petunjuk dan peringatan agar mereka bahagia di dunia dan di akhirat. Rahmat Allah bagi seluruh alam meliputi perlindungan, kedamaian, kasih sayang dan sebagainya, yang diberikan Allah terhadap makhluk-Nya. Baik yang beriman maupun yang tidak beriman, termasuk binatang dan tumbuh-tumbuhan.

Jika dilihat sejarah manusia dan kemanusiaan, maka agama Islam adalah agama yang berusaha sekuat tenaga menghapuskan perbudakan dan penindasan oleh manusia terhadap manusia yang lain. Seandainya pintu perbudakan masih terbuka, itu hanyalah sekedar untuk mengimbangi perbuatan orang-orang kafir terhadap kaum Muslimin. Sedangkan jalan-jalan untuk menghapuskan perbudakan disediakan, baik dengan cara memberi imbalan yang besar bagi orang yang memerdekakan budak maupun dengan mengaitkan kafarat/hukuman dengan pembebasan budak. Perbaikanperbaikan tentang kedudukan perempuan yang waktu itu hampir sama dengan binatang, dan pengakuan terhadap kedudukan anak yatim, perhatian terhadap fakir dan miskin, perintah melakukan jihad untuk memerangi kebodohan dan kemiskinan, semuanya diajarkan oleh Al-Qur'an dan Hadis. Dengan demikian seluruh umat manusia memperoleh rahmat, baik yang langsung atau tidak langsung dari agama yang dibawa Nabi Muhammad. Tetapi kebanyakan manusia masih mengingkari padahal rahmat yang mereka peroleh adalah rahmat dan nikmat Allah.
text.108: Allah memerintahkan kepada Muhammad agar menyampaikan kepada orang kafir dan kepada orang yang telah sampai seruan kepadanya, bahwa pokok wahyu yang disampaikan kepadanya ialah tidak ada tuhan yang berhak disembah selain Allah. Karena itu hendaklah manusia menyembah-Nya, jangan sekali-kali mempersekutukan-Nya dengan sesuatu pun seperti mengakui adanya tuhan-tuhan yang lain selain Dia, atau mempercayai bahwa selain Allah ada lagi sesuatu yang mempunyai kekuatan gaib seperti kekuatan Allah. Dan serahkanlah dirimu kepada Allah dengan memurnikan ketaatan dan ketundukan hanya kepada-Nya saja, dan ikutilah segala wahyu yang diturunkan kepada Nabi Muhammad saw.
text.109:
Kemudian Allah mengingatkan Muhammad, akan tugasnya sebagai seorang Rasul, yaitu hanya menyampaikan agama Allah kepada manusia. Karena itu juga mereka tidak mengindahkan seruanmu, tidak mengikuti wahyu yang disampaikan kepada mereka, maka janganlah kamu bersedih hati, dan katakanlah kepada mereka bahwa kamu telah menunjukkan kepada mereka jalan yang lurus, menuju kebahagiaan yang sempurna. Jika mereka tidak mau mengikuti dan menempuh jalan yang telah dibentangkan itu berati mereka ingin mendapat azab dari Allah.

Pada ayat lain Allah berfirman:

Dan jika mereka (tetap) mendustakanmu (Muhammad), maka katakanlah, "Bagiku pekerjaanku dan bagimu pekerjaanmu. Kamu tidak bertanggung jawab terhadap apa yang aku kerjakan dan aku pun tidak bertanggung jawab terhadap apa yang kamu kerjakan." (Yunus/10: 41)

Jika orang-orang kafir menanyakan kepada kamu Muhammad tentang kapan azab yang dijanjikan itu akan ditimpakan, maka katakanlah kepada mereka bahwa engkau tidak tahu menahu tentang waktunya, kapan azab itu akan ditimpakan, karena wewenang sepenuhnya berada di tangan Allah, dan tidak seorang pun yang mengetahuinya.
text.110: Allah Maha Mengetahui segala yang dikatakan oleh orang-orang kafir tentang agama Islam, baik dikatakan secara terang-terangan atau pun dikatakan secara berbisik, dan Allah mengetahui tentang kebencian hati orang-orang kafir terhadap kaum Muslimin. Karena itu Dia akan memberikan balasan yang setimpal kepada orang-orang yang demikian.
text.111: Allah memerintahkan pula agar Muhammad memberitahukan kepada orang kafir bahwa ia tidak mengetahui sedikit pun mengapa azab itu ditunda datangnya. Boleh jadi agar mereka menikmati segala kesenangan duniawi sampai kepada waktu yang ditentukan Allah, maka Allah akan menimpakan azab secara tiba-tiba tanpa diketahui darimana datangnya.
text.112:
Karena orang musyrik Mekah semakin hari bertambah-tambah kezaliman mereka, maka Muhammad berdoa kepada Tuhan agar Dia segera menimpakan azab kepada mereka. Permohonan Muhammad ini dikabulkan Allah dengan kekalahan orang musyrik pada beberapa peperangan yang terjadi antara kaum Muslimin dengan kaum musyrik.

Qatadah berkata, "Para nabi dahulu berdoa":

Ya Tuhan kami, berilah keputusan antara kami dan kaum kami dengan hak (adil). Engkaulah pemberi keputusan terbaik." (al-A'raf/7: 89)

Maka Rasulullah saw diperintahkan Allah untuk mengucapkan doa yang demikian itu.

text.1:
In this verse, Allah explains that the Day of Account (hisab), or the reckoning of deeds for mankind, is near. On that Day of Account, all the actions they performed while alive in the world will be reckoned. Furthermore, they will be held accountable for all the blessings that Allah has bestowed upon them, whether the blessings are within themselves, such as intellect, food and drink, as well as offspring and possessions. They will be asked, what have they done with all these blessings? Have they used Allah's gifts to do good deeds in obedience to Him, or have they used them to commit acts that prove their denial and disobedience to Him?

Allah affirms that mankind is indeed negligent of what Allah will do to them on the Day of Resurrection. This negligence is what causes them not to think about the Day of Resurrection, so they do not prepare themselves in the best possible way to protect themselves from Allah's punishment.

The people referred to in this verse are the polytheists (musyrikin). They are those who do not believe in the Day of Resurrection and deny the existence of the Day of Resurrection and the Day of Account (hisab). Nevertheless, this verse warns them that the Day of Account is near. This is to emphasize that the Day of Resurrection, including the Day of Resurrection and the Day of Account, will surely come, even though they do not believe in it; and the Day of Account will be followed by days of recompense for good or bad deeds.

The polytheists are negligent and unwilling to think about the bad fate that they will encounter on the Day of Account and the Day of Recompense. In fact, with sound reason alone, one can be convinced that good deeds should be rewarded with goodness, and evil deeds should be rewarded with torment and punishment. However, because they are unwilling to think about the bad consequences they will receive in the Hereafter, they always turn away and close their ears whenever they are warned with verses of the Qur'an containing threats and so on.
text.2: In this verse, Allah demonstrates the proofs of the negligence and indifference of the polytheists, such as when they heard the verses revealed by Allah, which were conveyed to them by the Messenger of Allah (saw), they did not heed them, and even mocked them. Thus, this verse is a warning not only for the disbelievers but also a stern warning for anyone who does not want to take lessons from the verses conveyed to them. The lessons, warnings, and threats contained in those verses do not touch their conscience. They merely hear, but do not pay attention to them or reflect upon them.
text.3:
In this verse, Allah explains what they conceal in their hearts, namely the conversations among themselves that they hide from others, concerning the Messenger of Allah. They say to each other that Muhammad is just an ordinary human being like them, and that what he conveys to them is merely magic. This is one of their efforts to incite the masses not to pay attention to the verses of the Qur'an that the Messenger conveys to them. Because, according to their assumption, Muhammad (peace be upon him) is an ordinary human being, like other humans. He also eats, drinks, lives with a family, works, and strives to earn a living, while the verses he conveys are merely magic. Therefore, he is not worthy of being listened to, paid attention to, or obeyed.

However, their statement that the verses are magic actually reflects an acknowledgment that these verses are something that amazes them, and they feel unable to match them. It is just that, because they want to prevent others from listening to these verses and learning from them, they call them magic, so that others will stay away from them.

The words of the polytheists above show that they reject the prophethood of Muhammad in two ways. First, by saying that a Messenger must be from among the angels, not from among humans, whereas Muhammad is also a human being, because he has the same characteristics and behavior as other humans. Second, by saying that the verses he conveys are a kind of magic, not a revelation from Allah.

They keep both types of accusations secret among themselves, as an effort to find the most appropriate way to destroy the religion of Islam. They keep it secret because it has become a tendency for humans that they will not invite their enemies to negotiate in finding ways to damage and destroy those enemies.
text.4: This verse explains that in response to the accusations and attacks of the polytheists, the Messenger of Allah (saw) affirmed that Allah knows all the words spoken by His creatures, whether in the heavens or on the earth, whether words spoken openly or kept secret, because He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing. Therefore, even if the polytheists conceal their evil plans, Allah still knows them, and He will reward them with torment and punishment. Thus, this verse contains a threat to the polytheists.
text.5:
In this verse, Allah explains that the wickedness of the polytheists was not limited to simply saying that Muhammad was not a Messenger and that the Qur'an was magic. They also said that the Qur'an was a jumble of confused dreams. Some even said that the Qur'an was merely something fabricated by Muhammad himself. Furthermore, some among them said that Muhammad was a poet. They also demanded that Muhammad (saw) bring a miracle other than the Qur'an, like those shown by previous messengers. Yet, the Qur'an itself is the greatest miracle of Prophet Muhammad.

Thus, they did not know that the Qur'an was a revelation from Allah to Muhammad (saw). And they did not acknowledge that the Qur'an was a miracle bestowed upon him by Allah as proof of the truth of his prophethood and messengership.

Whoever has an honest heart and possesses knowledge of the Arabic language and its high literature will surely acknowledge that the language and content of the verses of the Qur'an are truly astonishing. However, the polytheists have twisted this reality.
text.6: This verse affirms that even if their demands were granted, they still would not believe. This reality had already occurred with the polytheists in previous times. They also did not believe even though their demands were granted. That is why Allah destroyed them. So, what is the reason to grant the demands of the polytheists who exist now? Allah already knows that they also will not believe. And *sunnatullah* (Allah's law) will not change; whoever is unjust will surely be destroyed. Therefore, the Quraysh polytheists who do not believe in Muhammad, and who act unjustly, will also surely be destroyed.
text.7:
In this verse, Allah explains that He has never sent a messenger except from among ordinary human beings to whom He gave revelation. If they truly did not know that the messengers sent by Allah were human beings and not angels, they could ask those who know well, from among the Jews and Christians, because they knew about this matter and never denied it.

In another verse, Allah commands Prophet Muhammad to say to the polytheists that he is a human being. Allah says:

"Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is but one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone." (al-Kahf/18:110)

So Prophet Muhammad is not an exception from the previous messengers.
text.8: The polytheists attacked the Messenger of Allah, where they alluded to the human characteristics visible in the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). They said, why does the messenger eat food like other humans, and walk in the markets (to trade), as mentioned in Surah al-Furqan, verse 7. So in this verse, Allah explains that He made the messengers people who eat food, and they do not live eternally in the world, because they are also human beings, who need food, drink, sleep, and to live in households. It is just that Allah has chosen them to convey His message to mankind, and given them revelation containing guidance and direction, to bring mankind out of the darkness of disbelief into the bright light of faith. The Messenger as a guide is an ordinary human being who does not possess supernatural qualities, but is only given revelation.
text.9: Allah promised every messenger He sent that He would save the messenger along with his followers who had believed. In addition to that, Allah also promised to destroy the disbelieving people and the rebellious among their people. This is as explained in Surah Hud, which contains stories about the prophets and messengers. So in this verse, Allah affirms that He has fulfilled His promise to the previous messengers, so that they and their people were saved by Him from the oppression of the disbelieving and polytheistic people who denied His religion and rejected His messengers. Such is the fitting reward for them. A similar promise will also be fulfilled to Prophet Muhammad and the loyal Muslims.
text.10: In this verse, Allah directs His word to all of mankind, that He has revealed this book, the Al-Qur'an, which contains teachings and values that lead to their glory both in this world and in the hereafter. Therefore, it is fitting that they understand its contents and practice them in the best possible way.
text.11:
In this verse, Allah explains that many lands whose inhabitants were unjust have been destroyed, and then the inhabitants of those lands were replaced with a people who believed and did righteous deeds.

In connection with this, Allah has stated in another verse as follows:

And how many generations have We destroyed after Noah. (al-Isra'/17: 17)

And His saying in another verse:

And how many a city did We destroy while it was committing wrong, so it lies fallen upon its roofs... (al-Hajj/22: 45)
text.12: In this verse, Allah explains the state of the disbelievers at the time of the calamity's occurrence. After they were certain that Allah's punishment would inevitably befall them, as had been warned by the prophets and messengers, they fled in utter disarray. Previously, they had arrogantly said to their messengers, "We will surely drive you out of our land, or you will return to our religion." Now, on the contrary, they are the ones forced to leave their homes and villages, fleeing from Allah's punishment.
text.13: In this verse, Allah explains that when they fled to save themselves from the impending disaster, they were ordered to return to their original places, where they had experienced Allah's blessings, in order to answer the questions that would be posed to them, as their accountability to Allah.
text.14: In this verse, Allah explains the response of the disbelievers to the aforementioned command. It was then that they regretted and acknowledged the injustice they had committed all along. They said, "Oh, woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers." However, that admission and regret were of no use anymore. Allah's punishment could no longer be avoided. Regret beforehand is beneficial, regret afterward is useless.
text.15: This verse affirms that they constantly repeated such complaints, but Allah's punishment had befallen and destroyed them, so they became like crops that had been harvested, ruined, and impossible to revive.
text.16:
This verse explains that Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and everything in between for a futile or playful purpose, but rather with a true purpose, in accordance with His wisdom and perfect attributes.

This statement is a response to the attitudes and actions of the disbelievers who deny the prophethood of Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), as well as the miraculous nature of the Qur'an. Because of the accusations leveled against him, namely, that the Qur'an was made by Muhammad, not a revelation and miracle sent down by Allah to him. This attitude shows that they do not acknowledge Allah's creation, as if Allah created something only for play, without a true and noble purpose. Whereas Allah created the heavens, the earth and its contents, and what is in between, so that humans would worship Him and strive to know Him through His creation. However, this purpose can only be fully achieved if the creation of the universe is followed by the sending down of a Book containing guidance and by sending messengers to guide mankind. The Qur'an, besides being a guide for mankind, also functions as the greatest miracle for Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), to prove the truth of his prophethood. Therefore, those who deny the prophethood of Muhammad are also those who consider that Allah created this universe in vain, without a noble purpose and wisdom, without any benefit and usefulness.

If humans want to pay attention to everything on this earth, both what appears on its surface and what is stored in the bowels of the earth, they will surely find many wonders that show the power of Allah. If he is convinced that all of this was created by Allah for the benefit and progress of human life itself, then he will feel grateful to Allah, and believe that all of it was created by Allah based on a noble purpose because everything provides countless benefits. If a person reaches such a conviction, he will certainly not deny the Qur'an and will not reject the prophethood of the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).

In line with the content of this verse, Allah has said in other verses.

"And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them in play. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve, so woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire." (Surah Sad/38: 27)

And Allah's word again:

"We did not create them except with truth, but most of them do not know." (Surah Ad-Dukhan/44: 39)
text.17:
To thoroughly understand the erroneous assumptions of the disbelievers, in this verse, Allah adds clarification that if Allah had created this universe with the intention of mere play, then Allah could have created amusements according to His will, like the actions of kings who build magnificent palaces with thrones and comfortable beds. However, Allah did not intend this, and would not do such a thing. Allah created the heavens and the earth for the happiness of human life, and to be a means of reflection for humans so that they believe in the greatness of their Creator and obey Him. Therefore, Allah created the heavens and the earth with wisdom and a high purpose, in accordance with the loftiness of His status. Playfulness and relaxation are characteristics of creatures, not characteristics of Allah.

Humans are also among Allah's creations, created based on wisdom and noble purpose, and given advantages over His other creatures. Therefore, humans must be responsible for all their actions, and Allah will reward them with reward or punishment, according to the good and evil of those actions.

Some commentators (mufassirin) interpret the word *lahwan* in this verse to mean "child." So, according to them, if Allah wanted to take a child, He would certainly take it from among His creatures that are in accordance with His attributes, namely from the angels, for example, as Allah says in other verses:

"If Allah had willed to take a son, He could have chosen whom He willed from what He has created." (az-Zumar/39: 4)

Meanwhile, other commentators interpret *lahwan* to mean "wife."

However, having a wife, children, and descendants is not a characteristic of Allah, but rather the characteristics of His creatures; while Allah is not the same as His creatures. Having a wife and children means that Allah needs others, while Allah does not need anyone besides Him at all, so having a wife and children becomes impossible for Him. Therefore, the assumption of some people that Allah has a child is a misguided assumption.
text.18:
In this verse, Allah affirms that He destroys falsehood with truth, so that the truth obliterates the falsehood, until it vanishes completely. What is meant by falsehood here are characteristics and actions that are futile and useless, including playfulness and mockery. While what is meant by truth here are characteristics and actions that are serious and beneficial.

At the end of this verse, Allah gives a stern warning to the disbelievers, that punishment and disaster are prepared for them, because they have attributed evil characteristics to Allah, namely characteristics that are not befitting for Him, for example, being playful in creating His creatures, Allah having a son, wife, and so on.
text.19: In this verse, Allah reminds us again of His absolute power, both in the heavens and on the earth, which is that He is the One who creates, controls, regulates, manages, gives life, causes death, rewards, and inflicts punishment upon His creation. There is no one besides Allah who has the authority and right to interfere in these matters. Likewise, His power extends to His creatures who are near to Him, namely the *muqarrabin* angels, whom He has given a noble position, who are obedient and devoted, and who worship Him without ceasing, and do not feel tired or weary in serving Him.
text.20:
In this verse, Allah explains how the angels worship Him, which is by constantly glorifying Him day and night without ceasing.

In another verse, Allah says about these angels:

"Who do not disobey Allah in what He commands them but do what they are commanded." (at-Tahrim/66: 6)
text.21:
In this verse, Allah demonstrates the error and foolishness of the polytheists, because they do not adhere to the teachings of *tauhid* (monotheism), but instead worship "gods from the earth," namely idols which are inanimate objects, made by their own hands from earthly materials. It is certain that inanimate objects cannot maintain and manage living beings, let alone revive those who are already dead. While God is capable of doing so.

The idols they worship are referred to in this verse as 'gods from the earth.' This shows how low the status of their gods is, because these gods are made from earth, or from other objects found on this earth, and are only worshipped by humans. While the true God is worshipped by all creatures, both on earth and in the heavens.

Thus, it is clear how misguided the beliefs and actions of the polytheists are, because they deify what is not worthy of being deified.
text.22:
In this verse, Allah provides rational proof based on the truth of the belief in *tauhid* (monotheism) and faith in Allah, the One and Only God. That is, if there were two gods in the heavens and the earth, both would surely be ruined, and all the creatures between them would perish. This is because, if there were two gods, two possibilities would arise:

First, that the two gods might not have the same opinions and desires in managing and controlling this universe. Then, their differing desires would all be fulfilled, where one wants to create, while the other does not, so that the universe would be suspended between existence and non-existence. Or, only the desires of one party would be fulfilled, then the other god would certainly be idle and inactive. Such a state is not befitting for a god.

Second, that the gods would always agree in creating something, so that every creature is created by two creators. This shows the inability of each god to create his own creatures. This is also not befitting for a god. Therefore, the correct belief is to believe in pure *tauhid* to Allah, that nothing is associated with Him in creating and maintaining this universe. This belief is the most in accordance with sound reason.

Thus, belief in Islam is contrary to both atheism and polytheism.

After presenting rational arguments, Allah affirms that He is glorified and exalted above all the unworthy attributes attributed to Him by the *mushrikin* (polytheists), for example, that He has a son, or partners in creating, regulating, managing, and maintaining His creation.
text.23:
To strengthen the explanation that Allah is Exalted above attributes that are not befitting of God, in this verse, Allah mentions His absolute power over all His creation, so that no one has the authority to question, examine, or demand accountability from Him for any of His actions. Indeed, it is emphasized that it is humankind who will be held accountable for their every action. This is because Allah is the true Judge and Ruler. Allah creates everything always based on His knowledge and high wisdom, as well as His compassion and justice towards His servants.

In this regard, Allah has said in another verse:

"Then, by your Lord, We will surely question them all, about what they used to do." (al-Hijr/15: 92-93)

And His saying:

"While He protects [against all], and there is no protection from Him, if you should know." (al-Mu'minun/23: 88)
text.24:
In this verse, Allah reaffirms His refutation of the polytheists regarding their belief that Allah has partners, or that there are gods other than Allah. After they were given clear evidence and arguments about the oneness of Allah, they were then asked, do they still not believe, and still take gods besides Allah? This demonstrates their extreme ignorance and denial. Because, if it were not so, they would have immediately embraced the belief in *tauhid* (monotheism) and abandoned the belief in *shirk* (polytheism), after obtaining such clear explanations and evidence.

Furthermore, in this verse, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad to convey a challenge to the polytheists, that if they still hold onto the belief in *shirk* and reject the teachings of *tauhid*, they should also present evidence and explanations that prove the truth of their belief.

However, they will never be able to answer that challenge, either based on arguments based on reason (rational), or with evidence in the form of teachings found in the Gospel (Injil), the Torah (Taurat), or the Psalms (Zabur).

The challenge implies that if the polytheists believe that their belief is correct, they should show proof and evidence, because they have the Al-Qur'an which Allah revealed to the Prophet Muhammad, and the Gospel which was revealed to the Prophet Isa, and the Torah which He revealed to the Prophet Musa, and the Psalms which He revealed to the Prophet Daud. Show a verse found in those holy books that justifies the belief in *shirk*.

Surely, they will not be able to show the intended proof, because all the holy books only teach the belief in *tauhid*, and do not justify the belief in *shirk*. This proves that the religion of Islam and all the religions conveyed by the messengers before Muhammad, are based on the same foundation, namely the pure belief in *tauhid* to Allah. It is just that, after those messengers passed away, some of their followers abandoned the belief in *tauhid*, and returned to the belief in *shirk*, because most of them did not know what was right, which is why they turned away from the truth of their holy books.
text.25: In this verse, Allah affirms that every messenger sent before Muhammad (peace be upon him) was a human being to whom He had given revelation, tasked with teaching that there is no god but Allah. Therefore, it is an obligation for mankind to worship Allah alone. And there is not a single argument, whether based on reason or taken from the holy books conveyed by all the messengers of Allah, that justifies belief other than the belief in *tauhid* (Oneness of God) to Allah.
text.26:
In this verse, Allah mentions the accusation of the polytheists who said that the angels are the children of Allah. Then Allah refutes this accusation by affirming that He is Most Holy from that accusation, and that the angels are His servants who are given honor.

Having children is one of the characteristics of nature or creatures that are "new," while Allah is "Qidam" (eternal). It is also a characteristic of needing family life and descendants, which is also a characteristic found in creatures, while Allah is not like His creation.

Besides that, a child certainly has similarities with his father in one aspect, and differences in another. Therefore, if it were true that the angels were the children of Allah, then they would also be worshipped, even though Allah has affirmed that only Allah is worthy of worship and the angels always worship or serve Allah.

In short, the angels are not the children of Allah, but rather His servants, only that they are servants of Allah who are given honor and a place close to Allah and given superiority over all creatures, because their obedience in worshiping Him exceeds other creatures. However, humans who are believers, obedient, and righteous are more noble than angels.
text.27:
In this verse, Allah mentions the accusation of the polytheists who say that the angels are the children of Allah. Then Allah refutes this accusation by affirming that He is Most Holy from that accusation, and the angels are His servants who are given honor.

Having children is one of the characteristics of nature or creatures that are "new," while Allah is "Qidam" (eternal). It is also a characteristic of needing family life and offspring, which is also a characteristic present in creatures, while Allah is not like His creation.

Besides that, a child certainly has similarities with his father in one aspect, and has differences in another aspect. Therefore, if it were true that the angels are the children of Allah, then they would also be worshipped, even though Allah has affirmed that only Allah is worthy of worship and the angels always worship or serve Allah.

In short, the angels are not the children of Allah, but rather His servants, only that they are servants of Allah who are given honor and a place close to Allah and given superiority over all creatures, because their obedience in worshiping Him exceeds other creatures. However, humans who are believers, obedient, and righteous are more noble than angels.
text.28:
In this verse, Allah explains why the angels are so obedient and devoted to Him, which is because the angels are certain that Allah always knows what has existed and what they are doing, so that nothing escapes His knowledge and supervision. Therefore, they constantly worship and obey all His commands.

Furthermore, in this verse, Allah explains another characteristic of the angels: they will not give intercession (syafaat) to anyone except those whom Allah approves of. Therefore, no one should hope to obtain intercession or help from the angels on the Day of Judgment unless they first obtain Allah's pleasure (rida).

In addition to that, the angels are always cautious, due to fear of Allah's wrath and punishment. Therefore, they constantly distance themselves from disobeying Him or violating His commands and prohibitions.
text.29: In this verse, Allah explains His decree that applies to the angels and anyone among His creation who claims to be a god besides Allah. The decree is that whoever among them says, "I am a god besides Allah," then he will be rewarded with the torment of Hellfire (Jahannam), because such a claim is a great act of shirk (polytheism), because in addition to associating partners with Allah, it also equates his own status with Allah. That is how Allah repays the deeds of the wrongdoers.
text.30:
In this verse, Allah reveals that the polytheists and disbelievers of Mecca do not pay attention to the state of this nature, and do not pay attention to the events that occur in this vast universe, even though from various events in nature, evidence can be obtained about the existence of Allah and His absolute power. The heavens and the earth, which were once a solid unity, were then separated by Allah. The earth, before becoming the habitat of various living creatures, was a satellite, namely a celestial body orbiting the sun. This initially very hot earth satellite, because it continues to rotate, eventually becomes cold and dewy. The dew eventually becomes a clump of water. This is the source of life for creatures.

According to scientists and technologists, there are three opinions related to life beginning from water, namely: First, life began from water, in this case the sea. The modern theory of the origin of life was not firmly agreed upon until about two or three centuries ago. Before that, the prevailing theory regarding the origin of life was a concept called "spontaneous generation." In this concept, it was agreed that living things spontaneously exist from nothingness. This theory was then opposed by several experts around the 1850s, including Louis Pasteur. Starting with research conducted by Huxley and up to current research, other theories have been offered as alternatives.

This theory believes that life emerged from a long and complex chain of chemical reactions. This chemical chain is believed to have started in seawater, because the atmospheric conditions at that time had not yet developed into an area that could be inhabited by living creatures due to excessive ultraviolet radiation. It is estimated that life moved towards land 425 million years ago when the ozone layer began to exist to protect the earth's surface from ultraviolet radiation.

Second, the role of water for life can also be expressed in the form that all living things, especially animal groups, originate from seminal fluid (sperm). It is indicated that the diversity of animals "comes" from specific water (sperm) that is special and produces what is appropriate to the characteristics of each animal exemplified.

Third, the third understanding is that water is an important part for creatures to live. In reality, most of the parts of living things are made up of water. For example, in humans, 70% of their body weight consists of water. Humans cannot survive long if only 20% of the water supply in their body is lost. Humans can survive for 60 days without food, but they will soon die within 3-10 days without drinking. It is also known that water is a basic ingredient in the formation of blood, lymph fluid, urine, tears, milk fluid and all other organs in the human body.

From the description above, the role of water for life is very clear, starting from the existence of living things on earth (originating from the depths of the sea), for their survival (water is needed for the formation of organs and to carry out organ functions) and to start life (especially for the animal group "specific water" - sperm).

However, it is necessary to note here that the Qur'an does not provide a special opportunity to support the theory of evolution. Although all the verses above give an unmistakable indication that Allah created all living things from water. Verses related to an-Nur/24:25, al-Furqan/25: 54.

From this explanation, it can be understood that the Qur'an is truly a great miracle. Its miraculousness does not only lie in its beautiful language and summaries, but also in the content contained in its verses, which reveals various kinds of highly valuable knowledge, especially regarding nature, with its various types and properties and their respective benefits. Moreover, if we remember that the Qur'an stated all of this in the sixth century after the death of Prophet Isa (Jesus), when humans in this world were still shrouded in an atmosphere of ignorance and error. So from where did Prophet Muhammad know all of this, if not from the revelation that Allah sent down to him?

The development of modern science in various fields confirms and strengthens what has been revealed by the Qur'an since fifteen centuries ago. Thus, the progress of science should lead humans to faith in what is taught by the Qur'an, especially faith in the existence of Allah and all His attributes of perfection.

After presenting knowledge about the occurrence of this nature, namely the heavens and the earth, in this verse Allah also teaches another principle of science, namely regarding the importance of the function of water for the life of all creatures living in this nature, both humans, animals and plants. So Allah says, "... and We made from water every living thing."

In this day and age, no one will deny the importance of water for humans, both for various human needs, for the needs of their livestock, or for the interests of plants and their fields, so people carry out various irrigation efforts, to find sources of water and storage and distribution. Many dams are built to collect and store water, which is then distributed to various places for various needs. Even in countries that do not have many water sources, they try to process sea water into fresh water, to irrigate fields and provide drinking water for their livestock. In short, humans, animals and plants cannot live without water.

Humans and animals can survive for days without food, as long as they get a drink. But they will not be able to live without getting a drink for just a few days. The same is true of plants. If it does not get water, then its roots and leaves will become dry, and eventually die completely. In addition, humans and animals, besides needing water for their lives, also come from water, which is called "nuthfah."

Thus, water is a very vital element for the occurrence and life of humans. Therefore, if humans are convinced of the importance of water for their lives, and are also convinced that water is one of Allah's blessings, then there is no reason for humans not to believe in Allah and to deny His invaluable blessings.

At the end of this verse, Allah reminds us all, whether with this omnipotence of Allah, humans still do not want to believe? Humans who have reason and want to use their reason should be able to understand the contents of this nature and then become believers.
text.31:
In this verse, Allah directs human attention to the mountains, roads, and vast plains that exist on this earth. Allah explains that the creation of sturdy mountains is so that the earth, in its very rapid rotation, remains stable, with the preservation and protection of humans and all creatures on its surface. The earth's surface, which covers 510 million square kilometers, consists of 29% land, which is 153 million square kilometers, and 71% water, which is 357 million square kilometers. Thus, mountains that are up to 3-5 km high from sea level can maintain the tranquility of the earth's inhabitants, even though it rotates very quickly.

At the end of this verse, Allah explains that all creatures can calmly live their lives, various roads have been made so that day and night humans can walk through valleys and highlands. All of this is so that humans can obtain true guidance, namely, to understand Allah's guidance, both that given through written revelation and Allah's guidance in the form of this vast, expansive nature.
text.32:
In this verse, Allah directs human attention to the celestial bodies, which He created in such a way that each moves and orbits in an orderly manner, without falling or colliding with one another. All of this is maintained by a force called "gravity" between these celestial bodies, including the sun and the earth. This is also clear evidence of the existence and power of Allah. However, many people do not pay attention to this evidence.

In fact, if we fly in an airplane above an altitude of 10,000 miles, we see clouds below us, and the rain that falls is also below us, so it is clear that the earth is covered by a very strong sky, and the earth's atmosphere and the oxygen needed by humans and various plants and animals are maintained, limited by that very strong, guarded sky.

According to scientists, this verse confirms that the sky is a preserved roof. Like a roof, the sky functions to protect everything beneath it, including humans. Unlike the moon, because it has no protector, we find the surface of the moon is very uneven, filled with craters due to collisions with meteors. The Earth's atmosphere destroys all meteors approaching Earth and filters out harmful rays from fusion energy explosions in the sun. The atmosphere only allows harmless rays and radio waves to enter. Ultraviolet rays, for example, are only allowed in a certain amount that is needed by plants to carry out photosynthesis, and in turn, provide benefits to humans. In the atmospheric layer, there is a protector called the "Van Allen radiation belt" which protects the earth from celestial bodies heading towards it. Thus, the sky has acted as a protective roof for creatures on earth.

This roof of the sky will continue to be maintained as long as the earth exists, because these protective layers are related to the structure of the earth's core. The Van Allen belt is produced from the interaction of the magnetic field generated by the earth's core. The earth's core contains many magnetic metals, such as iron and nickel. The nucleus itself consists of two parts, a solid inner core and a liquid outer core. These two layers each rotate along with the earth's rotation. This rotation creates a magnetic effect on the metals in the earth's structure, which in turn forms a magnetic field. The Van Allen belt is an extension of this magnetic field that extends to the outermost layer of the atmosphere.

How great is the knowledge and wisdom of Allah who always protects His creation. Why are such things not understood by many people, so that they still turn away from the truth and power of Allah, even though the signs of Allah's power in this universe are so clear.
text.33:
In this verse, Allah directs human attention to His power in creating night and day, as well as the sun that shines during the day, and the moon that shines at night. Each revolves in its orbit within the vast expanse of the horizon, the limits of which only Allah knows.

The existence of day and night is due to the Earth's rotation on its axis, in addition to its orbit around the sun. The part of the Earth that receives sunlight experiences daytime, while the part that does not receive sunlight experiences nighttime. The light of the moon is sunlight reflected by the moon onto the Earth. In addition, the moon also revolves around the Earth.

This verse reaffirms what Allah has stated in Surah Ibrahim/14:33. It is widely known that the sun and moon have "orbits". However, the idea that "each of them (day and night) revolves in its orbit" is a newly understood concept. Why should day and night revolve in an orbit (manzilah), and what is the shape of that orbit?

After study, it turns out that what is meant by "orbit" is the location of places on Earth that experience the transition from day to night, or the setting of the sun (gurub). Along the equator, this line shifts from East to West in accordance with the sequence of places where the sun sets or the transition from day to night occurs.

The time of sunset also shifts along with the apparent movement of the sun relative to the Earth from north to south and vice versa. This shift in the time of Maghrib also shifts and forms its own location, which can be said to be the annual orbit of the transition from day to night. On certain days (at the beginning of the month), the time of sunset is also the beginning of the visibility of the hilal (the crescent moon at the beginning of the month). This crescent is very thin and faint, making it very difficult to observe (ruyah). The time of the hilal's rising shifts from East to West, and as with the transition from day to night, its orbit also differs from one place to another on the Earth's surface. When mapped, the location of the places where the hilal rises, similar to the time of sunset, will form a spiral that intersects the Earth's surface two or even three times.

The explanations contained in the verses above are to serve as natural proofs (dalil-dalil alamiyah), in addition to rational arguments and explanations found in previous holy books, about the existence and power of Allah, to reinforce what He has mentioned in His previous words, that "if" there were gods other than Allah in the heavens and on Earth, both would be ruined and destroyed.
text.34:
This verse affirms that Muhammad, as a human being, is the same as other human beings, namely that he will not live eternally in this world. Allah has never granted eternal worldly life to anyone before the birth of the Prophet Muhammad. Even though he is His Prophet and Messenger, he will surely leave this transient world when his appointed time comes. And they too will not remain in this world forever. This is one aspect of Allah's justice towards all His creatures, and it is His Sunnah that applies throughout time.

In another verse, Allah says:

And Muhammad is but a messenger; [other] messengers have passed on before him... (Ali 'Imran/3: 144)

So this verse states more emphatically that the Prophet Muhammad will leave this transient world, just as the messengers who came before him did. However, even though he will one day die, the Islamic religion that he has developed will continue to exist and grow, because Allah has given a guarantee for its victory. Therefore, it is very wrong for the polytheists to expect that with the death of the Prophet Muhammad, the development of the Islamic religion will stop, and Islamic da'wah will subside. Historical reality later showed that after the death of the Prophet Muhammad, Islamic da'wah continued to progress so that the Islamic religion developed far beyond the borders of the Arabian Peninsula, both to the East, North, as well as to the West and South.
text.35:
In this verse, Allah states even more emphatically that every living creature will surely experience death. None are eternal except Him. In this regard, Allah says in another verse:

"Everything will perish except His Face." (al-Qashash/28: 88)

Furthermore, in this verse, Allah explains that the trials He inflicts upon humans are not only in the form of bad things or undesirable calamities, but also in the form of goodness or good fortune. If the trial or test is in the form of a calamity, then the purpose is to test the attitude and faith of the person, whether he is patient and relies on Allah (tawakkal) in accepting the trial. And if the trial is in the form of goodness, then the purpose is to test the mental attitude of the person, whether he is grateful for all the blessings bestowed upon him by Allah.

If a person is patient and relies on Allah (tawakkal) in accepting trials or calamities, and is grateful to Him in receiving goodness and good fortune, then he is among those who achieve victory and have strong faith and obtain His pleasure (rida). Conversely, if he complains and his faith is damaged in accepting Allah's trials, or he becomes arrogant when receiving His blessings so that he is not grateful to Him, then that person is among the people who are at a loss and far from Allah's pleasure (rida). This is what is meant in His saying in another verse:

"Indeed, mankind was created anxious: When evil touches him, impatient, and when good touches him, withholding [of it], except the observers of prayer." (al-Ma'arij/70: 19-22)

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that no matter how people behave in facing trials or in receiving His blessings, in the end, all matters return to Him. He is the One who gives recompense, whether reward or punishment, or grants forgiveness to whomever He wills.
text.36:
In this verse, Allah explains the attitude and behavior of the disbelievers towards the Prophet Muhammad, which is that every time they saw him, they made the Prophet the target of their mockery and ridicule, saying to each other, "Is this the one who insults your gods? Yet they are the ones who are heedless of remembering Allah."

Such was their mockery of the Messenger of Allah. And they did not realize that they were the ones who deserved to be mocked, because they worshipped statues and idols, which had no power to do anything for them. In fact, their own hands made their gods, so they became the creators while their gods became creatures that were created. Thus, the situation was reversed from what it should be, because a god should be the creator, not the created.
text.37:
In this verse, Allah first explains that humans are created as beings with a nature of haste and impulsiveness. Then, Allah warns the disbelievers not to ask for the hastening of the punishment that has been threatened to them, because Allah will surely show them the signs of His punishment.

Here, we can understand that Allah forbids humans from being hasty, asking for something to be brought about quickly before its time, even though it is certain to come. In addition, Allah explains that even though the characteristic of haste has been made by Him as one of the characteristics of humans, humans have been given the ability to restrain themselves and overcome this characteristic, by accustoming themselves to being calm, patient, and cautious.

The characteristic of haste and impulsiveness always leads to bad consequences and is detrimental to oneself or others, which will ultimately lead to endless regret. Conversely, a calm, patient, careful, and cautious attitude can lead a person to what they aim for, and achieve brilliant success in their life. That is why the Qur'an always praises those who are patient, and promises them that Allah will always give them protection, guidance, and help. While those who are hasty, quick to anger, easily deceived by the temptations of the devil that will plunge them into the abyss of destruction, and deviate from the truth will suffer loss.

The request of the disbelievers for Allah's punishment to be brought upon them immediately clearly shows their disbelief in the existence of that punishment, as well as their denial that Allah is able to inflict punishment on the unjust.
text.38:
In this verse, Allah shows how reckless the disbelievers were when they said to the Prophet Muhammad and the Muslims with a defiant attitude, "When will the promised punishment of the Hereafter come? If the threat is true, then show it to us now!"

They asked for Allah's punishment to be brought upon them immediately. This statement shows that they did not believe at all in the existence of that punishment. Consequently, they also did not believe in the Day of Judgment, nor in Allah's power to reckon and recompense human deeds.
text.39:
